security: Several documents are marked SECRET, including personnel action requests detailing Harvey's retirement and reassignments. Disclosing these documents would reveal personnel management practices within the CIA and the classification levels applied to such information. Example: "SECRET (When Filled In) REQUEST FOR PERSONNEL ACTION"
summary: This file contains documents related to William K. Harvey, including a New York Times obituary, correspondence regarding his retirement from the CIA, and personnel action requests detailing his assignments and salary adjustments.
summary_one_paragraph: This file, reviewed by House Select Committee on Assassinations staff, contains various documents pertaining to William K. Harvey, a CIA aide reportedly involved in anti-Castro plotting. Included are a New York Times obituary noting his death and connection to assassination plots, letters acknowledging his service and retirement from Richard Helms, and personnel action requests outlining his reassignments, salary, and eventual voluntary retirement in December 1967. These documents detail Harvey's career within the CIA, including his role as Chief of Station and his participation in the CIA Retirement and Disability System.
title: Harvey, William R. OP File
